results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Jason Camenzuli, Sean Croyston, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.

results.title: The Door
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jo-Anne McGowan and Josie Keys
results.brief_description: A bedroom door becomes the focus of a teenage girl’s battle with her insensitive stepfather to reclaim the simpler relationship she remembers sharing with her mother. Stars Barry Otto and Penne Hackforth-Jones. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Figures in motion
results.creator_credit: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Eadweard Muybridge was the pioneer photographer whose experiments in stop-motion photography helped develop the technology that resulted in motion pictures. In this elegant fictional film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.
Cast: Michael Percival, Lenore Munro, Anthony Cogin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS

results.title: Great falls
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Libby Porter and Yves Stening
results.brief_description:
Jackie and his father return from a duck shooting trip to find his mother preparing to leave home with a young Air Force officer. She tells Jackie that she wants “a less domestic life”. Jackie doesn’t really understand what has happened but he knows that these things do happen and that life goes on somehow. “… I thought to myself that my life had turned … it was something that happened
to you - I knew that - and it happened to me in this way now.” Based on the short story by Richard Ford.
results.description:

results.title: Zipper: great moments in art and fashion
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio

results.title: Guru
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Pascal Guilloux and Safina Uberoi
results.brief_description: In the West, people fall in love and then get married. In India, people get married and then fall in love. But this is not India - this is Parramatta, in Sydney, Australia…A film celebrating cultural clashes amidst a wild and wonderful festival of colour. Original format 16 mm.

results.brief_description: No matter what the doting Helmut does, his wife Gertrude is never satisfied. But things are about to change. When an ever-increasing drip starts falling from the sky onto Gertrude’s head, it’s Helmut to the rescue!

results.title: Milk
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Anthony Johnsen, Jane Keneally and Mairi Cameron
results.brief_description: The Old Man lives on his own, and has done so for as long as he can remember. He doesn’t go out except to buy milk. The Downstairs Woman lives directly below. Every evening she comes home from work, walks upstairs and borrows a jug of milk.

results.title: Odd jobs
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim
results.brief_description: Two Boy Scouts, intent on earning money by doing odd jobs, stumble upon a spooky old house and its macabre owner. He looks forward to scaring them with his “house of horrors” - but young boys today aren’t so easily frightened.
